learnVocabulary.title: Vocabulary Foundations
learnVocabulary.subtitle: Grow your Macedonian vocabulary through high-frequency themes and intentional review.
objectives: Master 120+ high-frequency Macedonian words across daily topics.
Pair Macedonian words with clear English meanings and sample sentences.
Build a review habit using spaced repetition and mini quizzes.
howTo: Skim a track, then pick one deck to review aloud and write in your own context.
Log the new words in your spaced flashcards and mark any uncertain forms.
Close with a quick check: quiz yourself, translate a sentence, or ask the tutor for a role-play.

everyday.title: Everyday Essentials
everyday.description: Core words for greetings, numbers, food, and directions.
items: Greetings, pleasantries, and small talk
Numbers, time, and calendar vocabulary
Food, drinks, shopping, and money basics

situational.title: Situational Sets
situational.description: Targeted vocabulary for travel, work, and study scenarios.
items: Transport, lodging, and navigation phrases
Office, school, and technology terminology
Health, emergencies, and helpful questions

expansion.title: Expansion Decks
expansion.description: Broaden your vocabulary with synonyms, antonyms, and collocations.
items: Topic-based word families with example sentences
Common collocations and expression bundles
Mini quizzes that combine new and review words

activities.title: Spaced Flashcards
activities.description: Review 15 words per day using a spaced repetition deck. Say each word aloud and write a short personal sentence.

activities.title: Category Sprints
activities.description: Pick one topic, set a five-minute timer, and list as many Macedonian words as you can. Compare with the answer sheet afterward.

activities.title: Conversation Swap
activities.description: Create a short dialogue that uses at least five target words. Practice with a partner or record yourself for playback.

resources.title: Dictionaries
resources.description: Browse bilingual dictionaries and reference tools.

resources.title: For learners
resources.description: YouTube channels and podcasts tailored for Macedonian learners.

resources.title: Macedonian Language
resources.description: Video lessons and cultural clips to reinforce new words.

learnVocabulary.starterDecksDescription: Grab a focused list to warm up quickly.

starterDecks.title: Family & friends
starterDecks.description: Affectionate greetings, check-ins, and shared memories.

starterDecks.title: Travel essentials
starterDecks.description: Tickets, directions, and polite requests on the go.

starterDecks.title: Daily routines
starterDecks.description: Meals, chores, and personal schedule vocabulary.

nextActions.title: Open the phrase refresher

learnGrammar.title: Grammar Building Blocks
learnGrammar.subtitle: Understand how Macedonian sentences work by focusing on structure, cases, and verb aspect.
objectives: Review sentence structure and word order for statements and questions.
Learn case endings for definite nouns and pronouns.
Contrast imperfective and perfective verbs in everyday contexts.

structure.title: Sentence Structure
structure.description: Create accurate statements, questions, and negations.
items: Word order patterns for subject, verb, and object
Yes/no vs. information questions
Negation with '–Ω–µ' and placement rules

cases.title: Cases & Articles
cases.description: Understand Macedonian definite endings and object pronouns.
items: Definite article endings by gender and number
Direct and indirect object pronouns
Common prepositions and the case they require

verbs.title: Verb Aspect
verbs.description: Use imperfective vs. perfective verbs to signal progress or completion.
items: Aspect pairs with everyday verbs
Present, past, and future conjugation review
Modal verbs and periphrastic constructions

activities.title: Sentence Scramble
activities.description: Rebuild shuffled word cards into a correct Macedonian sentence. Say it aloud, then convert it into a question.

activities.title: Case Drill
activities.description: Write three mini-dialogues that use direct and indirect objects. Highlight the endings and pronouns you choose.

activities.title: Aspect Journal
activities.description: Describe yesterday's actions twice: once with imperfective verbs for context, and once with perfective verbs for outcomes.

resources.title: Macedonian dictionary
resources.description: Look up declensions and verb forms in the official dictionary.

resources.title: DW –Ω–∞ –º–∞–∫–µ–¥–æ–Ω—Å–∫–∏
resources.description: Read clear news prose to see sentence patterns in context.

resources.title: –ê—Ä—Ö–∞–Ω–≥–µ–ª
resources.description: Dive into language reference articles and literary archives.

learnPhrases.title: Conversation Phrases
learnPhrases.subtitle: Practice set phrases and build confidence for real-world interactions.
objectives: Deliver natural introductions and polite exchanges.
Handle travel and logistics scenarios with ready-made phrases.
Respond to invitations, plans, and social cues.

introductions.title: Introductions
introductions.description: Start conversations smoothly and share personal details.
items: Greetings, names, and origins
Talking about family, work, and hobbies
Inviting people to continue the conversation

travel.title: Travel Toolkit
travel.description: Navigate transport, lodging, and dining situations.
items: Buying tickets and asking for schedules
Checking in, directions, and wayfinding
Ordering food and handling the bill

social.title: Social Flow
social.description: Keep conversations going and respond gracefully.
items: Expressing preferences and opinions
Agreeing, disagreeing, and softening statements
Making plans and confirming details

activities.title: Role-Play Cards
activities.description: Pair up and act out a scenario card. Swap roles and add new phrases each round.

activities.title: Shadowing
activities.description: Listen to a native recording and repeat in sync. Focus on rhythm, intonation, and filler phrases.

activities.title: Phrase Builder
activities.description: Choose a phrase and extend it in three different directions (formal, friendly, humorous).

resources.title: Media
resources.description: TV and radio clips to practice real conversations.

resources.title: Podcasts
resources.description: Long-form discussions ideal for listening and phrasing.

resources.title: –®—Ç–æ –≥–æ –≤—Ä—Ç–∏ —Å–≤–µ—Ç–æ—Ç
resources.description: Conversational videos with natural pacing and slang.

learnPhrases.journeyPracticeSubtitle: Use these prompts to warm up before your next session.
learnPhrases.journeyPracticeNote: Say each sentence aloud, then respond in Macedonian to continue the conversation.

learnPronunciation.title: Pronunciation Lab
learnPronunciation.subtitle: Tune your ear and mouth to Macedonian sounds, stress patterns, and connected speech.
objectives: Produce Macedonian vowels and consonant clusters clearly.
Place stress correctly within common word families.
Improve listening comprehension with minimal pairs and dictations.

sounds.title: Sound Inventory
sounds.description: Map Macedonian vowels, consonants, and tricky clusters.
items: Vowel length and openness drills
Consonant clusters like '–≤—Ç', '–∑–¥', and '—à—Ç'
Soft vs. hard consonant practice

stress.title: Stress & Melody
stress.description: Hear and reproduce natural stress patterns.
items: Recognize default penultimate stress
Track stress shifts in conjugations and plurals
Use intonation to signal questions and emphasis

listening.title: Listening Lab
listening.description: Sharpen your ear with minimal pairs and micro-dictations.
items: Minimal pair discrimination exercises
Dictation drills with everyday phrases
Mouth-shape mimicry with mirror or recording

activities.title: Mirror Drills
activities.description: Record yourself reading a short passage, compare with a native sample, and note mouth shape adjustments.

activities.title: Stress Mapping
activities.description: Highlight stressed syllables in five new words each day, then read them aloud in a sentence.

activities.title: Dictation Bursts
activities.description: Play a ten-second clip, write down what you hear, and check against the transcript.

resources.title: Makedonkast
resources.description: Audio-first lessons that focus on pronunciation and rhythm.

resources.title: Media
resources.description: Newsroom clips to imitate stress and cadence.

resources.title: Podcasts
resources.description: Practice minimal pairs and connected speech with spoken shows.

translate.fallbackDescription: If the instant translator hiccups, try these quick options.
fallbackSteps: Refresh the page and submit the text again.
Break longer passages into 1-2 sentence chunks for better accuracy.

tips: Translate short sentences for better accuracy.

Use the resource library to confirm terminology and examples.

exercises.title: 15-minute greeting drill
exercises.description: Set a timer and rotate greetings, follow-up questions, and closing phrases in Macedonian. Record yourself once and note expressions that still sound unnatural.

exercises.title: Family story journal
exercises.description: Write a short family anecdote in English, then translate it to Macedonian. Highlight three phrases you want the tutor to check for tone.

exercises.title: Tone scale exercise
exercises.description: Say the same sentence in informal, neutral, and respectful variants. Note which suffixes and particles change.

resources.title: Kinship terms table

resources.title: Warm message reminder

exercises.title: Transport role-play
exercises.description: Write three questions for the Skopje bus station, then answer as the ticket counter. Swap roles and note which words you're missing.

exercises.title: Check-in checklist
exercises.description: List all the details you want to confirm at an apartment. Translate the list and practice with a polite introduction.

exercises.title: Market dialogue
exercises.description: Compose a short conversation for buying vegetables. Focus on quantities, prices, and polite expressions.

exercises.title: Listening lab

exercises.title: Three journal questions
exercises.description: Answer three questions connecting the topic to your experience. Share one answer with the tutor for feedback.

family.title: Family Conversations
family.intro: Connect with relatives through warm greetings, everyday stories, and supportive responses.
focus: Crafting natural greetings and follow-up questions
Responding to personal stories with empathy
Switching between informal and respectful tone
steps: Review the phrase set for introductions and family topics.
Translate three family anecdotes in the practice space.
Ask the tutor for a role-play to practice phone calls.

practice.phrases: Refresh greetings and warm check-ins before your next conversation.
practice.tutor: Ask the tutor to role-play family calls and help with tone.

travel.title: Travel Preparation
travel.intro: Feel ready for transport, lodging, and dining with confident phrases.
focus: Key verbs and nouns for transport and directions
Questions for hotels, rentals, and reservations
Etiquette for caf√©s, markets, and street encounters
steps: Do a translation exercise focused on transport vocabulary.
Browse the travel lists in the library and save favorites.
Ask the tutor to simulate ordering at a restaurant.

practice.tasks: Work through a set of transport tasks to cement key words.
practice.tutor: Have the tutor simulate booking and check-in before you leave.

culture.title: Cultural Literacy
culture.intro: Combine language learning with media, history, and cultural topics.
focus: Exploring headlines with grammar in context
Listening to podcasts to imitate pronunciation and rhythm
Journaling reflections in Macedonian for deeper retention
steps: Pick a featured article and summarize it in English and Macedonian.
Shadow a three-minute audio clip and note pronunciation progress.
Ask the tutor for journal prompts related to the article.

practice.translate: Translate current headlines to spot grammar and phrases.
practice.pronunciation: Work on pronunciation with the lab to imitate new sounds.

about.title: About
about.subtitle: MK Language Lab
about.description: A focused app for learning Macedonian through sentence-based practice, translation tools, and curated content.
about.feature1: Sentence-based practice with Word Sprint, Grammar drills, and vocabulary flashcards
about.feature2: Translator with Macedonian ‚Üî English support and saved phrase practice
about.feature4: XP tracking with daily goals and streaks
about.author: Created by
about.vincentBio: Building tools to reconnect with Macedonian roots and make language learning accessible to everyone.
about.creditsContent: Special thanks to Macedonian Language Corner for curated content and cultural insights.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.welcomeDesc: Learn Macedonian through bite-sized lessons, interactive practice, and daily challenges. Here's how to get started.
gettingStarted.step1Desc: Follow structured learning paths with lessons covering vocabulary, grammar, and cultural topics. Each lesson earns you XP and builds your streak.
gettingStarted.step2Desc: Reinforce your knowledge with Word Sprint, fill-in-the-blank exercises, and flashcards. Practice modes adapt to your level.
gettingStarted.step3Desc: Translate words and phrases between Macedonian and English. Save useful phrases to review later in the History tab.
gettingStarted.step4Desc: Earn XP daily to maintain your streak. Set a daily goal in Settings (10, 20, 30, or 50 XP) and try not to break your streak!
gettingStarted.step5Desc: Visit your Profile to see your stats, badges earned, and overall progress. Compete on leaderboards and earn achievements.
gettingStarted.tip1: Complete at least one lesson or practice session daily to keep your streak
gettingStarted.tip2: Tap any Macedonian word in the Reader to see its translation
gettingStarted.tip3: Use the app in Macedonian (Settings ‚Üí Language) for immersive learning

auth.signInRetiredDescription: The Macedonian Learning App now works without accounts.
auth.signInRetiredBody: All tools - including news, translation, the tutor, and the task board - are now available instantly. Update any bookmarks pointing to the old sign-in page.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: How we protect and handle your personal information
privacy.introduction: –ú–∞–∫–µ–¥–æ–Ω—Å–∫–∏ ‚Ä¢ MK Language Lab is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and safeguard your personal information when you use our educational web application. We are transparent about our data practices and comply with applicable data protection laws, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

section1.title: Information We Collect
section1.content: We collect minimal information necessary to provide and improve our services:
items: Google Account Information: When you sign in with Google OAuth, we receive your email address, name, and profile picture from your Google account.
Learning Progress: We store your learning activities, quiz results, saved lessons, and progress tracking to personalize your experience.
Usage Data: We collect anonymous analytics data about how you interact with the app to improve our features and user experience.
Error Logs: Through Sentry, we collect technical error information to identify and fix bugs in the application.

section2.title: How We Use Your Information
section2.content: We use your information for the following purposes:
items: Authentication: To verify your identity and provide secure access to your account.
Personalization: To remember your learning progress, preferences, and saved content.
Service Improvement: To analyze usage patterns and enhance the app's features and performance.
Error Resolution: To diagnose and fix technical issues that affect your experience.
Communication: To send important service updates (we do not send marketing emails).

section3.title: Data Storage and Security
items: Database: User data is securely stored in a PostgreSQL database with encryption at rest.
Authentication: We use NextAuth.js with industry-standard OAuth 2.0 protocol for secure authentication.
Rate Limiting: Upstash Redis is used to prevent abuse and protect your account from unauthorized access.
No Payment Data: We do not collect or store any payment information as our service is completely free.
Access Control: Only authorized personnel can access user data, and only for support and maintenance purposes.

section4.title: Third-Party Services
section4.content: We use carefully selected third-party services to provide our features. These services have their own privacy policies: Google OAuth (authentication), Sentry (error tracking and monitoring), Upstash Redis (rate limiting and caching), Time.mk and Meta.mk (RSS news feeds - we only display publicly available content). We do not share your personal information with third parties for marketing purposes.

section5.title: Your Data Rights
section5.content: You have control over your personal information:
items: Access: You can view all personal data we have stored about you.
Correction: You can update your profile information at any time.
Deletion: You can request deletion of your account and all associated data.
Export: You can request a copy of your data in a machine-readable format.
Withdraw Consent: You can stop using our services at any time.

section6.title: Cookies and Local Storage
section6.content: We use essential cookies and local storage to maintain your session and remember your preferences. These are necessary for the app to function properly. We do not use tracking cookies or third-party advertising cookies.

gdpr.title: GDPR Compliance
gdpr.content: For users in the European Union, we comply with GDPR requirements. Under GDPR, you have the following rights:
rights: Right to be informed about data collection and use
Right to access your personal data
Right to rectification of inaccurate data
Right to erasure (right to be forgotten)
Right to object to data processing
Rights related to automated decision-making and profiling

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your data rights, please contact us at:

section7.title: Mobile App Data Collection
section7.content: Our Android mobile app collects and stores data locally on your device to provide offline functionality and enhanced features:
items: Device Permissions: Optional notifications permission for daily practice reminders. Optional storage permission for caching audio files to enable offline practice.

Locally Stored Data: Practice progress and statistics stored on your device. Cached audio files for offline vocabulary practice. User preferences and app settings. All data follows the same privacy principles as our web app.

Third-Party Mobile Services: Expo Push Notifications for optional practice reminders (fully user-controlled). Google Cloud Translation API for translation features. OpenAI API for AI tutor conversations.

Data Sync: Your practice progress syncs with your account when online. You can disable sync in settings to keep data local-only. Offline mode allows full practice functionality without an internet connection.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: Guidelines for using the Macedonian Learning App
terms.introduction: Welcome to the Macedonian Learning App. By accessing or using our application, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. Please read them carefully. If you do not agree with these terms, please do not use our service.

section1.title: Acceptance of Terms
section1.content: By creating an account or using the Macedonian Learning App, you agree to:
items: Comply with all terms and conditions outlined in this document
Use the service only for lawful, educational purposes
Provide accurate information during registration
Maintain the security of your account credentials
Accept updates to these terms as we evolve the service

section2.title: User Responsibilities
section2.content: As a user of our educational platform, you agree to:
items: Use the app respectfully and for its intended educational purpose
Not attempt to access unauthorized areas of the application
Not abuse or overload our systems through excessive requests
Not share your account credentials with others
Respect intellectual property rights of all content
Not use the service to harass, harm, or impersonate others

section3.title: Intellectual Property
items: Original Content: All original lessons, exercises, and learning materials are created or curated by the Macedonian Learning App team and are protected by copyright.
Third-Party Content: News articles from Time.mk and Meta.mk remain the property of their respective publishers. We display RSS feed summaries under fair use for educational purposes.
User-Generated Content: Any content you create while using the app (notes, progress data) remains yours, but you grant us a license to store and display it as necessary to provide the service.
AI-Generated Content: Content generated through our AI tutor features is provided for educational use and should not be considered as professional advice.

section4.title: Prohibited Activities
section4.content: The following activities are strictly prohibited:
items: Attempting to hack, reverse engineer, or compromise the application's security
Using automated bots or scrapers to extract content
Violating rate limits or attempting to bypass security measures
Uploading malicious code, viruses, or harmful content
Using the service for commercial purposes without authorization
Impersonating other users or creating fake accounts

section5.title: Disclaimer of Warranties
section5.content: The Macedonian Learning App is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind. We strive for accuracy in our educational content, but we cannot guarantee that all information is error-free or complete. We are not responsible for decisions made based on content from our app. Language learning results vary by individual effort and circumstances. We do not guarantee specific learning outcomes.

section6.title: Changes to Terms
section6.content: We may update these Terms of Service periodically to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will notify users of significant changes through the app or via email. Continued use of the service after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated terms. The "Last Updated" date at the top of this document indicates when changes were last made.

section7.title: Third-Party Services
section7.content: Our app integrates with several third-party services. Use of these services is subject to their respective terms:

contact.title: Questions and Support
contact.content: If you have questions about these Terms of Service or need support, please contact us at:

alphabet.tip1: Macedonian is phonetic - each letter makes one sound, always.
alphabet.tip2: The stress usually falls on the third-to-last syllable (antepenultimate).
alphabet.tip3: Tap any letter to hear its pronunciation!
alphabet.softPairsDesc: These letters come in hard/soft pairs. The soft versions are palatalized.
alphabet.practiceDesc: Test your knowledge of the Macedonian alphabet
alphabet.completedDesc: You've viewed all 31 letters. Great job!
